Provision.Text: Whereas, pursuant to subsection 332(1)a of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999b, the Minister of the Environment published in the Canada Gazette, Part I, on February 26, 2011, a copy of the proposed Products Containing Mercury Regulations, substantially in the annexed form, under the title Regulations Respecting Products Containing Certain Substances Listed in Schedule 1 to the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999, and persons were given an opportunity to file comments with respect to the proposed Regulations or to file a notice of objection requesting that a board of review be established and stating the reasons for the objection;
Whereas, pursuant to subsection 93(3) of that Act, the National Advisory Committee has been given an opportunity to provide its advice under section 6c of that Act;

And whereas, in the opinion of the Governor in Council, pursuant to subsection 93(4) of that Act, the proposed Regulations do not regulate an aspect of a substance that is regulated by or under any other Act of Parliament in a manner that provides, in the opinion of the Governor in Council, sufficient protection to the environment and human health;

Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, pursuant to subsection 93(1) of the Canadian Environmental Protection Act, 1999b, on the recommendation of the Minister of the Environment and the Minister of Health, makes the annexed Products Containing Mercury Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 2, these Regulations apply to any product that contains mercury.
For the purposes of these Regulations, mercury includes any of its compounds.

Section.Text: These Regulations do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: waste;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product that is at the end of its useful life and that is intended to be recycled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food, drug, or cosmetic as defined in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a veterinary biologic as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Health of Animals Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a surface coating material as defined in subsection 1(1) of the Surface Coating Materials Regulations or a surface coating material applied to a toy regulated under the Toys Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a feed as defined in section 2 of the Feeds Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a fertilizer as defined in section 2 of the Fertilizers Act;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: an explosive regulated under the Explosives Act;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: ammunition and explosives under the direction or control of the Minister of National Defence;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a product, other than a battery, that has a mercury concentration of 0.1% or less by weight in homogeneous materials;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a battery, other than a button cell battery, that has a mercury concentration of 0.0005% or less by weight in homogeneous materials;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: beginning on January 1, 2016, a button cell battery that has a mercury concentration of 0.0005% or less by weight in homogeneous materials;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: from January 1, 2016 until December 31, 2019, a button cell battery that is incorporated into a medical device that is intended to remain in the body for at least 30 consecutive days;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: ores, concentrates and by-products of metallurgic operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: an on-road vehicle as defined in subsection 1(1) of the On-Road Vehicle and Engine Emission Regulations that is of the 2016 model year or of a previous model year as determined under section 5 of those Regulations.

Section.Text: A person must not manufacture or import any product that contains mercury unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product belongs to a product category set out in column 1 of the schedule, the maximum total quantity of mercury contained in the product is less than or equal to the quantity set out in column 2 and the person manufactures or imports the product on or before the end date set out in column 3; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds a permit issued under subsection 5(1).

Section.Text: An application for a permit must be submitted to the Minister in accordance with section 13 and must contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the applicant,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, fax number and email address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, fax number and email address of their duly authorized representative;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its common or generic name and its trade name, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total quantity of mercury contained in the product, expressed in milligrams,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the estimated quantity to be manufactured or imported by the applicant in a calendar year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an identification and description of each known use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that, at the time of the application, there is no technically or economically feasible alternative to or substitute for the product that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: achieves a similar result as would be achieved by using the product containing mercury, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has a less harmful effect on the environment or on human health than the product containing mercury;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of a plan that identifies and describes the measures that the applicant will take to minimize or eliminate any harmful effect that the mercury contained in the product has or may have on the environment and human health, including measures to ensure that the mercury is handled safely and is not released into the environment during normal use of the product and at the end of its useful life;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the plan is to be implemented within 30 days after the day on which the permit is issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the civic and postal addresses of the location where the information and supporting documents are kept.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must issue the permit if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has established that, at the time of the application, there is no technically or economically feasible alternative to or substitute for the product that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: achieves a similar result as would be achieved by using the product containing mercury, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has a less harmful effect on the environment or on human health than the product containing mercury; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has submitted the plan referred to in paragraph 4(d), and that plan sets out measures that can reasonably be regarded as measures that will minimize or eliminate any harmful effect that the mercury contained in the product has or may have on the environment and human health.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has provided false or misleading information in support of their application; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information and documents required under section 4 have not been provided or are insufficient to enable the Minister to process the application.

Subsection.Text: A permit expires three years after the day on which it is issued, unless it is renewed in accordance with subsection 6(2).

In order to have a permit renewed, a permit holder must submit to the Minister a renewal application, in accordance with section 4, at least 90 days before the day on which the permit expires and must include the number of the permit in that renewal application.
The Minister must renew the permit if the conditions in subsection 5(1) are met.
The Minister must revoke a permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the permit holder has provided false or misleading information.
Before revoking a permit, the Minister must provide the permit holder with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: written reasons for the revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an opportunity to make written representations in respect of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) to (5), any person that manufactures or imports a product that contains mercury must indicate the following information in a readily visible location on the product and, if applicable, on its package by means of a stamp, label or other mark:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statement “Contains mercury / Contient du mercure”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: safe handling procedures and the measures to be taken in case of accidental breakage, the address of a website where that information is available, or contact information for a person who can provide that information;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the options available for the disposal and recycling of the product in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction where the disposal or recycling is to take place, the address of a website where that information is available, or contact information for a person who can provide that information; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement to the effect that the product should be disposed of or recycled in accordance with the applicable laws.

Subsection.Text: The information must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear in both official languages;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be presented in a font size of at least 10 points with characters that are at least 3 mm in height, that are legible and indelible and that are impressed, embossed or in a colour that contrasts with the label’s background or the colour of the product, as applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be enclosed by a border; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: be easily distinguishable from other graphic material on the product or its package.

Subsection.Text: If the product is too small to accommodate the information, the information must be indicated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a readily visible location on the product’s package; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if there is no package or if the package is too small to accommodate the information, in a notice attached to the product or in a manual that accompanies the product. The notice or manual may provide the address of a website where the relevant information is available and must be provided

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a notice, in both official languages, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a manual, in English, French or both official languages, as requested by the first retail purchaser.

Subsection.Text: If the mercury is contained in a component of the product, the information must be indicated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a readily visible location on the product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a notice attached to the product or in a manual that accompanies the product. The notice or manual may provide the address of a website where the relevant information is available and must be provided

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a notice, in both official languages, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a manual, in English, French or both official languages, as requested by the first retail purchaser.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) to (4) do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: products belonging to a product category referred to in any of items 31 to 34, column 1, of the schedule; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: products that are manufactured for export.

Subsection.Text: Any person that manufactures or imports any of the following products must ensure that the symbol Hg is indicated in a font size of at least 10 points with characters that are at least 3 mm in height or within a pictogram of a least 7 mm in height such that it is legible and indelible and impressed, embossed or in a colour that contrasts with the label’s background or the colour of the product, as applicable, in the following location:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product belonging to a product category referred to in any of items 2 to 9, 12 to 14, 22 or 23, column 1, of the schedule, in a readily visible location on the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product that contains a product belonging to a product category referred to in item 10 or 11, column 1, of the schedule, in a readily visible location on an external surface of the product.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if a product referred to in paragraph (1)(a) is too small to accommodate the symbol Hg in a font size of at least 10 points with characters that are at least 3 mm in height, the symbol Hg must be indicated in the closest possible font size and character height and be, at a minimum, in a font size of 7 points with characters that are 2 mm in height.

Section.Text: Any determination of total quantity of mercury made for the purposes of these Regulations must be conducted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by a laboratory that is accredited by a Canadian accrediting body under the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO/IEC 17025:2005, entitled General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories, as amended from time to time, and the scope of whose accreditation includes the analytical method used to make the determination; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by a laboratory that is accredited under the Environment Quality Act, R.S.Q., c. Q-2, as amended from time to time, and the scope of whose accreditation includes the analytical method used to make the determination.

Heading.TitleText: Determination of the Total Quantity of Mercury in Electrotechnical Products

Section.Text: The total quantity of mercury contained in an electrotechnical product is determined using the International Electrotechnical Commission standard IEC 62321-4:2013, entitled Determination of certain substances in electrotechnical products — Part 4: Mercury in polymers, metals and electronics by CV-AAS, CV-AFS, ICP-OES and ICP-MS, as amended from time to time.

Subsection.Text: Any person that manufactures or imports a product that contains mercury — other than a product belonging to the product category referred to in item 34, column 1, of the schedule — must submit a report to the Minister in respect of the 2016 calendar year and every third calendar year after that year, on or before March 31 of the calendar year following the year in respect of which the report is prepared.
The report must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the person,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, fax number and email address, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the name, title, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, fax number and email address of their duly authorized representative; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: respecting the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its common or generic name and its trade name, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the product category, referred to in the schedule, to which the product belongs or the number of the permit issued under subsection 5(1), as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total quantity of mercury contained in the product, expressed in milligrams,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity manufactured during the calendar year in question, if applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity imported during the calendar year in question, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person that manufactures a product the mercury content of which is contained in a component that is itself a product that was subject to these Regulations at the time of its manufacture or import.

Any information required to be submitted to the Minister under these Regulations must be submitted electronically in the form and format specified by the Minister and must bear the electronic signature of the person that manufactures or imports the product containing mercury or of their duly authorized representative.

If the Minister has not specified an electronic form and format or if it is not feasible to send the information electronically in accordance with subsection (1) because of circumstances beyond the person’s control, the information must be sent on paper in the form and format specified by the Minister and signed by the person or their duly authorized representative. If no form and format have been specified, the information may be sent in any form and format.

Any person that manufactures or imports a product that contains mercury must maintain records that demonstrate that the product was manufactured or imported in accordance with the Act and these Regulations and that include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person that manufactures a product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the common or generic name of the product manufactured, and its trade name, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the product category, referred to in the schedule, to which the product belongs or the number of the permit issued under subsection 5(1), as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the product manufactured at each manufacturing plant,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the total quantity of mercury contained in the product, expressed in milligrams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of manufacture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person that imports a product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the common or generic name of the product imported, and its trade name, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the product category, referred to in the schedule, to which the product belongs or the number of the permit issued under subsection 5(1), as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the product imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the total quantity of mercury contained in the product, expressed in milligrams,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, civic and postal addresses, telephone number and, if any, the fax number and email address of the principal place of business of the shipper,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the port of entry at which the product was imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of import,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System number for the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the importer number for the product shipped, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: copies of the bill of lading, invoice and all documents submitted to the Canada Border Services Agency for the product shipped.

Subsection.Text: The records and supporting documents must be kept for a period of at least five years after the day on which the records are made.

Section.MarginalNote: Retention of information submitted to Minister
Section.Text: Any person that submits information to the Minister under these Regulations must keep a copy of that information and any supporting documents for a period of at least five years after the day on which the information is submitted.

Subsection.Text: The records, copies of information submitted to the Minister and supporting documents must be kept at the person’s principal place of business in Canada or at any other place in Canada where they can be inspected. If they are kept at any place other than the person’s principal place of business, the person must provide the Minister with the civic address of that place.
If the civic address referred to in subsection (1) changes, the person must notify the Minister in writing within 30 days after the change.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force one year after the day on which they are registered.
